page.title: 02Landscape of Lezant Area
page.content: The geology of the area consists mainly of{shale,limestone and grit}A thin band of{chert}runs west to east from Trewarlett through the grounds of Landue House.There are a few small intrusions of{diabase.Alluvium}has been deposited by the Lowley Brook. The Brook and its tributary streams have worn rounded valleys in the rolling countryside. The nature of the soil,and the South_West air stream which produces a warm,wet climate,lead to a mainly grass and cereal farming system.Some hedges have been removed to create larger field units,but the scenery is basically a pattern of quite small fields divided with old hedges,still with many trees surviving (see photo 1).
